articles.title: Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Pyongyang Essential Foodstuff Factory.
					 After looking round the monument to the field guidance provided by President Kim Il Sung, he enjoyed a bird's-eye view of the factory.
					
					 He went round the room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 After watching a video on the technological updating of  the factory, he said this factory helps compare the present with the past and picture what would be in the  future to oneself, adding it is the factory where the line of the three revolutions, ideological, technical and cultural, has been implemented.
					
					 The first leg of his guidance was the nursery of the factory.
					
					 Going round playing apparatuses, turf in the compound of the nursery and its sun room, kitchen, dining room, intelligence games room, breastfeeding room, education room and other places, he said that they have been arranged well to suit the upbringing of children and their minds.
					
					 After learning about how the house of culture of the factory is operated, he went round different production processes to acquaint himself in detail with their technological updating.
					
					 At the general control room he was greatly satisfied to see the production processes and business activities computerized at a high level.
					
					 Making the rounds of the newly installed production processes of refined table oil, seasoning, refined salt and vitamin E and their packing process, he learned about specifications and capacities of the equipment.
					
					 Seeing varieties of goods produced at the production processes based on latest technology, he said overall production processes have been highly automated.
					
					 He praised the factory for having realized the modernization of production and packing processes in cooperation with universities including Kim Il Sung University and Kim Chaek University of Technology.
					
					 What is important in technological updating is to step up modernization with our own efforts and technology, he said, calling for giving full play to the creative ingenuity of scientists, technicians and workers and raising the rate of the locally produced equipment.
					
					 He examined soy, soybean paste, seasoning, table oil, vitamin E, lecithin and other goods produced at the factory.
					
					 He dropped in at the e-library and scientific and technological library to learn about how the factory is applying latest technology to production.
					
					 Going round a public bath, swimming pool, beauty parlor, barber's, music room, etc. newly built by the factory, he praised it for having built welfare and service facilities well.
					
					 This factory is like a nice palace for the workers, the one meeting requirements of the era of the Workers' Party and the one pervaded with patriotism, he underscored the need for all the units to follow the example of the factory.
					
					 Expressing expectation and belief that the employees of the factory would successfully carry out their honorable duty, he had a photo session with them.
					
					 He was accompanied by Choe Ryong Hae, Mun Kyong Dok, Paek Kye Ryong, Choe Hwi, Pak Thae Song and Jon Chang Bok.

articles.title: CPRK Spokesman Proposes Working Contact to South Side
articles.content:
CPRK Spokesman Proposes Working Contact to South Side
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea (CPRK) gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Friday as regards the positive response of the south Korean authorities to the proposal made by the DPRK on holding talks between the authorities of the north and the south in its special statement:
					 As already reported, we issued a special statement on Thursday clarifying its crucial stand with the aim of providing a fresh and decisive phase in the north-south relations.
					
					 We appreciate the fact that the south side promptly and positively responded to the proposal made by us for holding talks between the authorities of both sides.
					
					 It is our view that working contact between the authorities of the north and the south is necessary prior to ministerial-level talks proposed by the south side in the light of the prevailing situation in which the bilateral relations have been stalemated for years and mistrust has reached the extremity.
					
					 So, we propose holding working contact between the authorities of the north and the south in Kaesong on June 9.
					
					 To this end, we will reopen the Panmunjom Red Cross liaison channel from 14:00 on June 7. We hope the south side will send its answer to our proposal through the channel.

articles.title: Congratulations to Bulgarian PM
articles.content:
Congratulations to Bulgarian PM
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Plamen Oresharski upon his appointment as prime minister of Bulgaria.
					 The message wished the Bulgarian prime minister success in his responsible work for the development of the country and its people's wellbeing.

articles.title: DPRK Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Back Home
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK players came back on Friday after participating in the 2013 Grand Prix Diving Game (stage 6) sponsored by the International Federation of Swimming that was held in Kazan, Russia.

articles.title: Art Performance Given by Schoolchildren
articles.content:
Art Performance Given by Schoolchildren
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A performance of the national art festival of schoolchildren was given at the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace to commemorate the 67th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union on Friday.
					 Among the audience were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of working people's organizations and those concerned and delegates to the 7th Congress of the KCU.
					
					 Put on the stage were colorful numbers including small chorus "A Floral Gate of Happiness", national instrumental music and dance "Very Good Is Our Country of Learning" and "I Am a Flower Bud", accordion and janggu "My Country Is the Best".
					
					 The audience was mesmerized by serial songs "We Are the Happiest in the World" and "The General and Children" which make them look back with deep emotion on the profound loving care shown by the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the children, while dedicating themselves to the children until the last moments of their lives. 
					
					 Poem and chorus "Let's Study for a Thriving Korea", small chorus "I Will Startle the World", high-pitched flute and dance "All Birds Fly in the Forest of Children's Union" and other numbers were warmly acclaimed by the audience as they reflected the resolution of the schoolchildren to do a lot of good work for the country with ardent love for the country and its people and stoutly grow to be pillars of Songun Korea.
					
					 In song and story-telling "Marshal Kim Jong Un, Thank You," girls  chorus "Happiness of Holding Marshal in High Esteem,"  drawing and dance "A Drawing Seen by Marshal" and other numbers the performers impressively represented the fact that the future of members of the KCU is bright thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Delegates to 7th KCU Congress Honored to Be Congratulated by Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Delegates to 7th KCU Congress Honored to Be  Congratulated by Kim Jong Un
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The delegates to the 7th Congress of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) were very happy to see the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un appearing in the hall of the congress held Thursday.
					 A year ago he made a congratulatory speech at the joint national meeting of the KCU organizations for celebrating its 66th birthday.
					
					 With a beaming smile on his face, he acknowledged the enthusiastically cheering delegates and carefully attended to the speeches made by schoolchildren and KCU instructors at the congress.
					
					 Upon hearing the speech made by the chairman of the Mangyongdae Revolutionary School Committee of the KCU, he called him to his side and highly praised him for his speech.
					
					 The congress hall was seized by his intense feelings of affection for schoolchildren.
					
					 Pak Song Ryong, a delegate from Kangwon Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I was in tearful bliss at the sudden appearance of respected Marshal Kim Jong Un at the congress.
					
					 I will study harder in order to make contribution to building a thriving nation, as desired by Kim Jong Un."
					
					 Kim Mok Ran, a delegate from South Hwanghae Province, said:
					
					 "I had a photo taken with respected Marshal Kim Jong Un when he was making an inspection tour of the defence attachment on Wolnae Islet in March this year. And today I made a speech at the congress and was honored to receive his hearty applauses.
					
					 I could clearly understand that we, children on Wolnae Islet, are always under his deep attention, although the islet is far away from Pyongyang."

articles.title: Chol Pass, Symbolic of Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership
articles.content:
Chol Pass, Symbolic of Kim Jong Il's Songun Leadership
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Kosan Fruit Farm in Kangwon Province, the DPRK, is turning to be a gigantic fruit producer.
					 Some days ago, the dear respected Kim Jong Un visited the fruit farm and said it is meaningful, indeed, that a large orchard has made its appearance at the foot of Chol Pass symbolic of the Songun (military-first) revolutionary leadership, adding a fresh fairyland called "sea of apples at foot of Chol Pass" will spring up when the project for expanding the capacity of the farm comes to a finish and a sea of apples is unfolded there.
					
					 The 32-kilometer-long Chol Pass consists of a range of steep uphill and downhill cliffs.
					
					 The Korean people call the pass a symbol of the Songun leadership.
					
					 In the 1990s, the U.S.-led imperialist forces made every conceivable effort to stifle the DPRK, which was invariably holding the banner of independence and the banner of socialism.
					
					 To cope with it, leader Kim Jong Il opted for enforcing Songun politics and made ceaseless inspection tours of the Korean People's Army units over the pass.
					
					 One day in March Juche 85 (1996), he personally drove the car on the pass covered with wet snow.
					
					 His Songun politics led the Korean-style socialism to make a steady headway.
					
					 Thanks to the politics, the KPA has now developed into a matchless powerful army and the DPRK has become a nuclear state.
					
					 A series of emotion-packed events were witnessed in the country and a number of edifies have been built for the people's wellbeing.
					
					 The DPRK people, well aware of the might of Songun politics, are now dynamically working to implement the line of the Workers' Party of Korea on simultaneously carrying on the economic construction and the building of nuclear forces.

articles.title: U.S., Wrecker of Korean Nation's Cultural Heritage: News Analyst
articles.content:
U.S., Wrecker of Korean Nation's Cultural Heritage: News Analyst
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Recently, a royal seal dating back to the period of the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910) was found to be possessed by an American art collector.
					 The seal, believed to be made in 1651, was looted in Seoul by the U.S. aggression forces during the Korean War (June 1950-July 1953). 
					
					 During the war, they robbed the Korean Central History Museum in Pyongyang and other museums in local areas of over 6 700 items of antiques and burnt away piles of historical documents.
					
					 They also plundered museums in south Korea.
					
					 They took away a golden crown dating back to the period of Silla Dynasty (1st century-935) on display at the museum of the Kyongbok Palace.
					
					 They took away a number of old paintings, calligraphic works and historical books in museums in Seoul.
					
					 Pubyok Pavilion in Pyongyang, Nam Gate in Kaesong City and other historical relics were all vandalized by them.
					
					 The aggression forces made use of the three tombs of Kangso in Nampho City as storehouses and turned the old tombs in Ryonggang County into prisons.
					
					 They blew up the Anak tombs in South Hwanghae Province.
					
					 In May-June 1951, they dropped napalm and incendiary bombs on the scenic Mt. Kumgang to set ablaze the historical relics in the mountain.
					
					 The U.S. forces' looting of cultural relics goes on still now in south Korea.
					
					 These facts clearly prove that the U.S. is a wrecker of the Korean nation's cultural heritage.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Trounces Its S. Korean Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Trounces Its S. Korean Rival
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- There took place semi-finals of the Asian U-14 women's soccer regional championship (eastern region) in Langfang City, Hebei Province, China.
					 The DPRK team belonging to Group B defeated its Japanese rival 3-1 and China's Taipei rival 7-0 to come first in the group.
					
					 The DPRK team beat its south Korean rival 1-0 in the semi-finals on June 7.
					
					 The DPRK team will play finals with its Chinese rival on June 9.

articles.title: National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools Close
articles.content:
National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools Close
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The 50th National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools were closed with due ceremony in Hungnam City on Friday.
					  Trophy cups and medals were awarded to the schools and players who proved successful in the games.
					
					 Kim Pyong Sik, vice-minister of Physical Culture and Sports, made a closing speech.

articles.title: Peace on Korean Peninsula Called for
articles.content:
Peace on Korean Peninsula Called for
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 2013 Kwangju Asia Forum released a Kwangju peace declaration on June 3 calling for ensuring the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					 The declaration referred to the struggle of the participants in the Kwangju popular resistance who bravely fought against the military fascist regime for the democratization of society and reunification of Korea 33 years ago.
					
					 Since then the trend of independence, democracy and peaceful reunification has become stronger in south Korea, the declaration said, and went on:
					
					 Military tensions have run high recently in the peninsula and its vicinity. The greatest victim is the Korean nation.
					
					 Calling for removing the danger of a war, the declaration voiced positive support for all the efforts for the conclusion of a peace treaty this year marking the six decades since the signing of the Armistice Agreement on the peninsula.
					
					 The declaration underscored the need to positively join in the push to defend the justice and ensure the peace on the peninsula.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Trying to "Internationalize" Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Denounced for Trying to "Internationalize" Inter-Korean Relations
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, south Korean puppet Minister of Unification Ryu Kil Jae cited "internationalization of the Kaesong Industrial Zone (KIZ)" as a reason why he is opposed to businessmen's visit to it. The chief of Chongwadae said that "an innovative change was necessary for internationalizing the KIZ rather than its simple normalization."
					 Minju Joson Friday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The "internationalization of KIZ" proposed by the south Korean puppet authorities is a provocation against the DPRK and mockery of and insult to the nation. 
					
					 It is the height of impudence to "internationalize" the KIZ, an economic development zone common to the nation built in the spirit of "By our nation itself" clarified in the June 15 joint declaration. 
					
					 The DPRK side made a bold decision to offer an area of Kaesong to the south side for promoting national reconciliation and cooperation though it is a very sensitive place from a military point of view. 
					
					 But, the south side is going to handle the KIZ like its own area, talking about "the internationalization of the KIZ" without any agreement with the north. 
					
					 What matters is that the "internationalization" sought by the south side is not limited to the KIZ only. It does not conceal the intention to "internationalize" all aspects of the north-south relations. 
					
					 It is due to the "internationalization" campaign of the south Korean authorities that everything in south Korea including peculiar and resourceful tradition and beautiful manners and customs of the nation are eroded and its society has become Americanized and Japanized.
					
					 Not content with this, they are working hard to make such tragic reality unfold in the DPRK under the signboard of "internationalization."
					
					 The moves for "internationalizing" the north-south relations are absolutely intolerable as it is an action to sell off the nation's dignity and sovereignty to outside forces. 
					
					 The DPRK, which regards the nation's dignity and sovereignty as its life and soul, will categorically reject the above-said moves. It will never be taken in by such base artifice.

articles.title: S. Korean Women File Suit against Official of Chongwadae for Sex Scandal
articles.content:
S. Korean Women File Suit against Official of Chongwadae for Sex Scandal
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- South Korean women filed a suit with the Seoul Central District Prosecutor's Office against Yun Chang Jung, former spokesman for Chongwadae, on June 4 for his sex scandal. They included Son Mi Hui, permanent representative of Women's Solidarity, Yu Son Hui, executive chairwoman of the Unified Progressive Party, and other women, more than 1 000 in all.
					 They accused Yun Chang Jung of sexually abusing a woman on May 7 during his business trip to the U.S.
					
					 They termed it a violation of the "special law on punishing sexual abusers."
					
					 Yun at a press conference told a lie, hurting the honor of the victim, they noted, adding that Yun should be brought to justice as that was also a violation of the law.

articles.title: Concealment of Secret Funds of Chun Doo Hwan's Family Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Concealment of Secret Funds of Chun Doo Hwan's Family Disclosed in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Kyunghyang Daily News on June 3 carried an editorial disclosing the fact that former military dictator Chun Doo Hwan and his family members tried to conceal secret funds they illegally amassed.
					 The editorial said it was disclosed on June 2 that the eldest son of Chun had operated a bogus company overseas for six years after setting it up. 
					
					 As for the area where the company was set up, some south Korean big businessmen had often used it for tax evasion and amassing of illicit funds, it said, and went on:
					
					 The fact that the minutes of the company's council carry the sign of the eldest son of Chun and other facts prove that he was related to the bogus company. 
					
					 It was disclosed that he got nervous when he failed to open an overseas account for saving money after establishing the company, in particular. This fact alone is enough to prove that he was suspected of concealing the secret funds. 
					
					 It is by no means a pure coincidence that the bogus company was established when the investigation into the secret funds of Chun Doo Hwan was at its height. 
					
					 It is necessary not to allow Chun Doo Hwan's family to lead a luxurious life with the illegally accumulated wealth down through generations, the editorial said, urging the prosecution authorities to thoroughly investigate the case, retrieve all the secret funds and punish those involved.

articles.title: Dismissal Measure against Part-time Workers under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Dismissal Measure against Part-time Workers under Fire in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- The Seoul Branch of the Public Part-Time Workers Union  under the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul Tuesday in protest against the dismissal measure against part-time workers.
					 The speakers at the press conference referred to the fact that recently the Songdong City Management Industrial Zone under the Songdong District Office issued a notice that the validity of the contract with more than 300 part-time workers would expire at the end of June.
					
					 They deplored that the part-time workers are threatened to be expelled from their worksites due to this notice which came like a bolt from the blue.
					
					 Noting that life of a part-time worker is not worth a fly and workers are treated like rejects, they condemned the above-said dismissal measure.
					
					 They demanded the Songdong District Office and the Sondong City Management Industrial Zone make a new contract with all of them.

articles.title: Lecture in Japan Commemorates Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Lecture in Japan Commemorates Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given in Tokyo on June 4 to commemorate the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Present there were officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, Koreans of different social standings, members of the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea and members of the Japanese Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration.
					
					 Speeches were made at the lecture.
					
					 The speakers said that the June 15 joint declaration serves as reunification programme which calls for independently solving the issue of the country's reunification by concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 Thanks to the publication of the joint declaration, the inter-Korean relations had turned into those of reconciliation and cooperation from those of distrust and confrontation and the June 15 era of reunification was opened, enjoying full support from all the Koreans and other people in the world, they said, adding:
					
					 After the emergence of the Lee Myung Bak regime in south Korea the inter-Korean relations have become hostile. The present chief executive is pursuing the policy of confrontation with the DPRK just like the preceding "government". 
					
					 If the south Korean chief executive has even an iota of national conscience, she should drop the confrontation policy and support and implement the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					 The U.S. is misleading the public opinion to give impression that the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula spawned because of the DPRK's possession of nuclear weapons.
					
					 The issue was caused because the U.S. introduced nuclear weapons into south Korea, steadily beefed up arms and equipment and staged nuclear war drills against the DPRK, posing greater nuclear threats to it.
					
					 They urged the U.S. to abandon the reckless adventure for a total nuclear war and opt for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: Application of Tuition-free Program for Senior High Schools Demanded in Japan
articles.content:
Application of Tuition-free Program for Senior High Schools Demanded in Japan 
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Japan on May 31 to denounce the Japanese government for its unreasonable step of excluding Korean schools from the tuition-free program for senior high schools and demanding  its immediate application.
					 Present there were a delegate of a mothers delegation of Korean schools which exposed the Japanese government's unreasonable policy of discrimination against Korean schools at the UN, Koreans and Japanese citizens including lawmakers, more than 170 in all.
					
					 Its attendants heard reports on activities of the mothers delegation of Korean schools.
					
					 Then followed speeches of Japanese personages.
					
					 The speakers expressed concern over the serious discriminating actions such as the suspension of payment of subsidies to Korean schools under an unreasonable pretext.
					
					 It is of weighty significance that the UN recommendation termed the Japanese government's discrimination an illegal act, they noted.
					
					 The discrimination against Korean schools has a bad impact on Japanese children, too, they said, underscoring the need to make every possible effort to eliminate the discrimination structure and have the tuition-free program applied immediately.
					
					 They stressed the need to provide correct information for building public opinion and hold a forum for resuming the payment of subsidies and thus contribute to deepening the understanding of Korean schools among Japanese citizens.
					
					 They called for reenergizing the movement to make a peaceful society by intensifying solidarity.
					
					 The floor was also taken by Koreans of different social standings.

articles.title: Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked by Guinean Broadcasting Services
articles.content:
Anniversary of June 15 Joint Declaration Marked by Guinean Broadcasting Services
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Guinean broadcasting services aired special programs on May 30 on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The Guinean domestic radio said under the title "Echo of June 15 era":
					
					 An astonishing event took place in Pyongyang, the capital of the DPRK, in June 2000.
					
					 There took place the north-south summit, the first of its kind, 55 years since the division of the Korean nation and the historic June 15 joint declaration which calls for settling the issue of Korea's reunification in an independent and peaceful way was adopted there.
					
					 The October 4 declaration, a programme for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, was adopted in 2007, which resulted in opening up a brighter prospect for the Korean nation's reunification movement.
					
					 All Koreans called such astonishing event the "June 15 era of reunification".
					
					 But after the emergence of the Lee Myung Bak regime in south Korea the movement for Korea's reunification faced a grave challenge. As soon as Lee came to power, he totally denied the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					
					 The north-south relations became tenser due to the Park Geun Hye regime. But the spirit of the June 15 era lives on.
					
					 The Korean nation is now waging a nationwide struggle to preserve the June 15 joint declaration and usher in the era of peace, reunification and prosperity again.
					
					 The international community sincerely hopes that the Korean nation will achieve the reunification of the country at an early date under the banner of the joint declarations and consolidate the peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The international radio and seven national languages radio of Guinea reported a similar program.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Accuse U.S. of Compelling DPRK to Have Access to Nuclear Weapons
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Accuse U.S. of Compelling DPRK to Have Access to Nuclear Weapons
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- Newspapers of Mexico and Bulgaria carried articles slamming the U.S. hostile acts against the DPRK.
					 The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on May 15 said illustrated with a photo of the dear respected Kim Jong Un inspecting a unit of the Korean People's Army:
					
					 U.S. high-ranking officials claim these days that they are interested in dialogue with the DPRK. But this is nothing but sophism to evade their blame for having pushed the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. which drove the situation on the peninsula into the worst phase by systematically and ceaselessly committing political and military provocations in a bid to stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 The paper gave a detailed account of the facts that the U.S. pulled up the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes, pushing the situation to an extreme phase and to cope with this, the DPRK took the toughest measures for self-defence.
					
					 The May 15-31 issue of the Bulgarian paper Novo Rabotnichesko Delo carried an article titled "U.S. compelled DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons".
					
					 The moves of the U.S. and south Korean authorities to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula have become all the more undisguised in their scope and danger, the article said, and continued:
					
					 The tense situation is prevailing on the peninsula because the U.S. has threatened the DPRK with huge forces for aggression including nuclear weapons.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean authorities staged large-scale military exercises targeting the DPRK in recent two months by mobilizing nuclear-powered carrier and strategic nuclear bombers.

articles.title: Russian Paper Accuses U.S. of Shunning Conclusion of Peace Treaty with DPRK
articles.content:
Russian Paper Accuses U.S. of Shunning Conclusion of Peace Treaty with DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, Jun 7 (KCNA) -- The Russian paper Tribuna on May 29 carried a commentary titled "DPRK proposes signing peace treaty".
					 The commentary said:
					
					 The DPRK's proposal for concluding a peace treaty is nothing new. It has so far proposed the signing of a peace treaty many times since the ceasefire but the U.S. has persistently rejected it.
					
					 This proposal proves who is the arch criminal escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula and who wants peace there.
					
					 The DPRK is foiling U.S. provocations, not yielding to its political and military pressure. 
					
					 The proposal for signing a treaty for guaranteeing security of all parties on the Korean Peninsula is nothing bad. The treaty can involve a stop to threat by strength and its use, withdrawal of foreign forces from south Korea, etc. This is what the U.S. is afraid of.
					
					 There are many precedents that the U.S. ignited wars but there is no precedent that it signed a peace treaty and pulled its forces back of its own accord.
					
					 The DPRK declared the Armistice Agreement (AA) null and void at a time when the U.S. threat reached an extreme phase recently.
					
					 The AA was meaningless as there took place military exercises which might lead to aggression any moment.
					
					 The strategic conclusion drawn by the DPRK in the tension escalating on the peninsula is that it can never dismantle its nuclear weapons, its means for defense.
					
					 The situation on the peninsula is requiring the conclusion of a peace treaty but the U.S. is shunning it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Personages of Mexico, Syria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Praised by Personages of Mexico, Syria
						
 Pyongyang, June 7 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Mexico and round-table talks in Syria on May 27 and 29 to mark the 49th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Ramon Jimenez Lopez, chairman of the Mexican National Coordinating Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea and chairman of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a great statesman, invincible and iron-willed commander and benevolent father of the nation who turned the DPRK into a single-mindedly united political and ideological power and invincible military power by wisely leading the party, state, army and people.
					
					 He is always remembered by progressive mankind as he made undying contributions to accomplishing the cause of the popular masses for independence and the cause of global independence, holding high the banner of independence against imperialism and the banner of socialism all his life.
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche, Songun revolutionary cause started by President Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The chairman of the Revolutionary Youth Union of Syria and the director of the international department of the union praised Kim Jong Il's feats in party building as an example to be followed by all the revolutionary parties of the world.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 We are struck with admiration at the fact that Kim Jong Un is leading the confrontation with the U.S. to victory while carrying forward the idea and line of the preceding leaders. His leadership provides a sure guarantee for enabling the youth and other people of the DPRK to achieve a final victory.
					
					 The DPRK is taking toughest measures in succession, standing firm against the U.S. escalating nuclear threat, an indication of the steadfast will to defend the sovereignty of the country. The Syrian people extend full support and encouragement to all measures taken by the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un se retrata con delegados al VII Congreso de la ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un se retrata con delegados al VII Congreso de la ONC
						
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, se retrato el dia 6 junto con los delegados al VII Congreso de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					Participaron en la filmacion el vicemariscal del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, y el jefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Yong Su.
					
					Estuvieron presentes tambien el presidente Jon Yong Nam y los vicepresidentes del CC de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung.
					
					Los ninos obsequiaron al Mariscal ramos de flores fragantes.
					
					Destacando que el VII Congreso de la ONC marca un hito importante para glorificar eternamente las inmortales hazanas de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il  quienes dedicaron todo lo suyo para el fortalecimiento del movimiento infantil de Corea, el Mariscal felicito calidamente a los participantes que a traves del conclave, demostraron a todo el mundo el gallardo aspecto de los miembros de la ONC quienes se preparan como fidedignos trabajadores que se encargaran en el futuro de la construccion de un Estado prospero.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los delegados al conclave estaran siempre al frente en consolidar su organizacion como filas de futuros protagonistas de la potencia del monte Paektu.

articles.title: CRPP propone contacto de trabajo de autoridades Norte-Sur
articles.content:
CRPP propone contacto de trabajo de autoridades Norte-Sur
						
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que la parte Sur de Corea acepto nuestra propuesta de sostener el dialogo de autoridades Norte-Sur, presentada en la declaracion especial, el portavoz del Comite por la Reunificacion Pacifica de la Patria dio el dia 7 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC: 
					Como trascendidos, el dia 6, hemos publicado una declaracion especial en que expusimos nuestra posicion importante para preparar una nueva coyuntura trascendental en las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas. 
					
					Valoramos la acogida positiva e inmediata de  la parte Sur a nuestra propuesta de sostener las conversaciones de autoridades. 
					
					Tomando en cuenta las circunstancias actuales en que las relaciones N-S quedan suspendidas por varios anos y llego al climax la desconfianza entre ambas partes, consideramos necesario anteponer el contacto de trabajo de las autoridades Norte-Sur a las conversaciones de nivel ministerial que propuso la parte Sur. 
					
					Por eso, proponemos primero sostener el dia 9 en Kaesong el contacto de trabajo de autoridades Norte-Sur. 
					
					Para ese fin, volveremos a poner en funcionamiento desde las 14 del dia 7 el canal de comunicacion de la Cruz Roja en Phanmunjom y deseamos que por esa via, la parte Sur de su respuesta a esta iniciativa.

articles.title: Efectuada funcion artistica dedicada al 67o aniversario de fundacion de ONC
articles.content:
Efectuada funcion artistica dedicada al 67o aniversario de fundacion de ONC
						
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 7 en el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae la funcion conjunta del festival artistico nacional de ninos escolares dedicada al 67o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC).
					La disfrutaron el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, los funcionarios de las entidades de masas y de sectores vinculados y los delegados al 7o congreso de la ONC.
					
					Se presentaron en la escena variadas piezas incluyendo el coro pequeno "Arco floral de felicidad", la musica con instrumentos nacionales y danza "Es mejor mi pais de educacion", el acordeon y tambor coreano "Nuestro pais es el mejor".
					
					Conmovieron mucho a la audiencia la serie de canciones "No envidiamos nada a nadie en el mundo" y "El General y los ninos" que hacen recordar al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes amaron mas que nadie a los ninos y trabajaron con abnegacion para ellos hasta el ultimo momento de su vida.
					
					Ademas, recibieron efusivas ovaciones la poesia y el coro "Aprendamos para Corea prospera", el coro pequeno "Seremos famosos del mundo", etc. que reflejan la determinacion de los ninos escolares de amar mucho a la patria y al pueblo, realizar muchos trabajos provechosos y prepararse como fidedignos trabajadores de la Corea del Songun.
					
					A traves de la cancion en narracion "Gracias al Mariscal Kim Jong Un", el coro femenino "Felicidad de tener al Mariscal", el dibujo y la danza "Dibujo examinado por el Mariscal" y otras piezas, los ejecutantes hicieron constar que es radiante el porvenir de los miembros de la ONC gracias al Mariscal.

articles.title: Imperialismo yanqui - destructor y saqueador de patrimonios culturales de nacion coreana
articles.content:
Imperialismo yanqui - destructor y saqueador de patrimonios culturales de nacion coreana
						
Pyongyang, 7 de junio (ACNC) -- Hace poco, fue descubierto en Estados Unidos el sello imperial de la dinastia feudal de Corea, hecho en 1651, lo cual centra la atencion de sociedad internacional.
					El sello, que estuvo conservado en Seul, fue perdido en el periodo de la pasada guerra coreana (junio de 1950-julio de 1953) por culpa de las tropas agresoras norteamericanas.
					
					Reaparecio esta vez en manos de un colector estadounidense de las obras de bellas artes.
					
					Asi, fue revelado a plena luz el crimen del imperialismo yanqui que destruyo y saqueo preciosas herencias culturales de la nacion coreana que reflejan su historia de 5 milenios.
					
					Durante la guerra coreana, el imperialismo yanqui destruyo sin piedad los museos inclusive el Museo Nacional de la Historia de Corea en esta capital y despojo mas de 6 mil 700 piezas de patrimonios culturales, ademas de quemar los datos de historia.
					
					Paso lo mismo con los museos en el Sur de Corea. Se puede citar por ejemplo el saqueo de la corona de oro de la epoca de Silla que estaba conservada en el museo del palacio Kyongbok.
					
					Resultaron agredidos tambien los cuadros y libros exhibidos en el museo folklorico situado en Namsan de Seul, el museo Changgyongwon y el museo de la Universidad de Seul y el museo de bellas artes del palacio real de Toksu.
					
					Ademas, el mirador Pubyok de Pyongyang, la gran puerta Nam de Kaesong y otras reliquias historicas y las tumbas antiguas fueron destruidos gravemente.
					
					Los agresores norteamericanos destruyeron las tres tumbas de Kangso de la ciudad de Nampho y las utilizaron como almacen y reformaron como reclusorios las tumbas antiguas del distrito de Ryonggang.
					
					La tumba antigua de An-ak de la provincia de Hwanghae fue destruida totalmente por el granadazo.
					
					En mayo y junio de 1951, el imperialismo norteamericano arrojo al monte Kumgang y sus alrededores las bombas de napalm e incendiarias acabando con valiosos vestigios historicos.
					
					Aunque pasaron 60 anos desde el cese de fuego, continua todavia en el Sur de Corea el saqueo de patrimonios culturales por parte de esos enemigos jurados del pueblo coreano.
